attributes.action: Do not invoke Article 50 without a public consultation and parliamentary debate.
attributes.additional_details: The U.K. voted to leave the EU by 52% to 48% on Thursday 23rd of June. However it is not clear exactly what relationship the British people would like with the EU. Article 50 entails a 2 year maximum period to negotiate a withdrawal and is irreversible. The U.K. has been greatly divided by the referendum and we should reach a national consensus and compromise on what future relationship we do want before invoking Article 50.
attributes.background: The undersigned, whether we voted to leave or remain, believe that the UK should not invoke Article 50 until a public consultation and parliamentary debate and vote has taken place. We should establish what relationship we do want with the EU before we commit to leave irrevocably.
